text: Food was fresh & so delightful! I walked in on them when they were closing and they fed this hungry prego woman! Lol I had a salmon bowl and it was sooo delish! I wanna try everything they have on their menu!!

Ordered delivery. Took a bit longer than it stated on the app but that's okay. Got the beef and onion bento box. Loved it. I always crave yoshinoya and there isn't one around. This place is delicious and tastes fresher. Miso soup has no seaweed or tofu or  green onion but it was very flavorful and not too salty.I wish the bacon around the quail egg was crispier but overall I enjoyed my meal and will be ordering from here again. Also,I think the prices are very reasonable. Definitely give this place a try! 


Update: 

Second time ordering from this place. This time I got the pork bento, beef and onion rice and noodle bowl and two miso soups. Food arrived faster than estimated which was a plus. And I was also happy to see that they've included utensils (very cutely packaged might I add) but I immediately notice that my miso soups are missing. I called the store in a panic and the lady on the phone explained to me that they ran out for the day and my card had been refunded. I am very disappointed since I was really looking forward to the soup... But just from a customer service standpoint, it would've been nice to have been alerted before my order arrived. In fact if they would have called and let me know I would've ordered something else in place of it. Other than that the beef and onion bowl was good per usual but the pork in the bento was a bit dry and in need of a sauce.
A nice place with great cozy atmosphere. I love eel and its really nice that they offer it. Staff is very friendly and a nice place to just stop by and grab a quick bento.
There is a playground nearby and have a lunch with kids beofre : ) I love their rice balls and mini rolls!!!

Staff was friendly. However, the food was awful. We got the Salmon Bento, miso soup and mini tuna roll. The salmon was super dry and tasted like it was cooked earlier than heated when served. Miso soup was bland with fishy seaweed and the tuna roll was just a strip of fish with unseasoned rice. Sorry, will not be going back.

I absolutely adore this place! Atmosphere is nice and welcoming (love the music :)). Food was AMAZING! Literally, so good. Portions are more than what I expected and the flavors are fantabulous. The owner was so so so nice. A nice lunch spot even though they open early lol love it. Love it a lot. Will definitely come back tomorrow.

Overall- 7/10

Food- 8/10 - I got a chirashi bowl, and I enjoyed it quite a bit. It isn't anything mind blowing but I usually tend to enjoy simpler flavors. The fish was decently fresh, but the eel really stood out. The eel was grilled perfectly and wasn't to overpowering with the sauce. 

Service- 6/10 - The service is really friendly but it's also extremely slow. It took them 20 minutes to prepare my bowl, so if you're in a rush, this place may not be for you. 

Portion- 7/10 - The portions here are good, though a little inconsistent. Some of the fish I got was sliced thinner than others, but I didn't mind.

New to the location.  Fresh and delicious.  Great friendly service.  #yummmm. So much freshness in a bento box.

Get there!

The cutest boxed lunch in Vegas!

FOOD: Their bento boxes are so worth it! I got the Eel Bento and it came with so much food. It included rice, 10 pieces of eel, salad, and a bunch of side dishes. They have a lot of other options such as noodle bowls, rice bowl, rice balls, rolls, salads, and soups. The squid salad is delicious. The miso soup sadly had no tofu or seaweed it in.

DRINK: They have this complicated filtered water machine that took me some time to figure out how to use. They give really tiny water cups so you constantly have to get up and refill your cup. They have an instant latte that you can purchase and use their hot water machine to make the latte. Surprisingly, they have a variety of smoothies that you can choose from. Everything is great to take-out orders.

SERVICE: The staff were extremely friendly. They just talk a lot....it kind of distracts them from putting together the orders quickly. The restaurant is really clean and bright.

Best bento place in Las Vegas. I wish it was close to my house. I wanna eat here everyday! I tried salmon bowl and spicy mayo rice ball. Decent portion, tasty, and reasonable price. There are lots of other menus like bentos, other bowls, mini rolls, and more. 

Clean interior and amazing design. Great service. Cute cashier.

I had been wanting to try Kuben for a while now, finally got the chance today and am kicking myself for waiting so long!!  

The bento box with about 6-7 pieces of salmon sashimi, 2 gyoza, edamame and 4 pieces of California roll all for about $13! The fish was fresh and they didn't skimp on it at all. 

The quality and the fact that it's less than 3/4 of a mile from my house pretty much guarantees Kuben will become a frequent in my sushi rotation!

Why are the bowls only filled half way?  Check out ALL the pictures.. All the other POKE places fill the bowls to the top.. NO return visit for my KUHL team... Also very slow to get your order. I was the only one there are it took 15 minutes no cooking required.. Seems the staff is all busy on their mobile texting in the back and out in the parking lot.

It's been about three months since this place opened and I like the concept of modernizing the Bento lunch. The compartments are comprised of your choice of protein (chicken, pork, beef or salmon) on a bed of rice, assorted pickled vegetables, a sausage (yup), salad and to my surprise, hard boiled quail eggs wrapped in bacon. This concept is concieved  by the owner who runs it with his wife. There are bowls also similarly topped. I tried the squid salad ( there's more) and it was spot on. 
I will be back and I wish this place all the best!

Stopped here to pick up some lunch after having class on a Wednesday afternoon. It is located in the plaza where perfect scoop used to be in a corner spot facing south. Parking is decent as this plaza isn't that busy overall. 

As with most, this is a korean owned japanese establishment offering bowls and bentos, as well as rice balls, and some other smaller things. 

Originally i wanted to get a rice bowl but was told id get more food when getting a bento. For a dollar difference, ($11 for fish bowl vs $12 for bento), i opted to listen and get the bento. I had been craving some eel for a while so thats what i got. 

Eel sounded like it was oven baked/heated as i heard a ding a minute or two before getting my food. 

You get about 12 slices of eel on top of a bed of rice with a side of lettuce/kale/tomato salad, pickled daikon and celery, slices of sweet egg and inari (the tofu pouch thing), mini sausage, and quail egg wrapped with bacon. The sides overall was decent. Only complaint would be the kale. They left the thick mid stem which is kind of hard to eat. I would have preferred the mid stem removed and the kale leaves to be cut into thinner strips. 

The eel was pretty decent. Very soft in texture. Not overly sweet. Maybe i was hungry. It was pretty good overall. Not bad for $12. Still looking for a place that would serve a rice bowl with a huge slab of unagi on top .. mmm XD

Finally a place to get quick simple rice balls!! After coming home from Japan, I had been hooked on just eating rice balls on the go. This place has them, and makes them fresh when you order it. The other food looked delicious, and nicely plated however, I have yet to try it.

Been wanting to try this place out, i love bentos! So I'm so glad that they were able to make one, in a shopping center where i wished had more food options! Management is very clean, staff is very accommodating when I requested modified orders. Cutest bentos, it was like receiving a package. I want to try the rice balls next time. Lots of sides to choose from, you get to pick 3 toppings additional items $1 so it kind of does add up. They don't have fountain drinks, when you check-in to claim your offer for the free drink its a limited selection of drinks from their fridge. I also wish they were open later than 3:30pm

I finally tried Kuben, as it has always caught my eye while visiting Recess Italian Desserts a few stores down. 

Very different presentation of the bento box from what I'm used to (being from Hawaii). But that doesn't mean that what it contains inside isn't good. I went for the beef bento box. Very flavorful. In the bento box, contained a bowl of salad, side garnishes/ veggies, sausage, quail eggs wrapped in bacon, and of course, teri beef with onions on a bed of white rice. All for $11.  Aside from the bento box, I also tried the salmon bowl. The salmon was soft and so fresh! You can get 3 free toppings on your bowl such as furikake, green onions, scrambled eggs , imitation crab, and edamame just to name a few. Each additional topping is a dollar.
The least thing I like was the chicken bowl. The chicken was kind of bland for my liking, but I am pretty sure that's right up the alleys of the healthy enthusiasts. The best part of the chicken bowl was the bottom layer where it contained noddles (comparable to Korean jap chae) and rice. 

Inside is small but, a very good and clean place to enjoy your food. Overall, a good experience. Will be back to try the unagi (eel) bento and the different variety of what they call rice balls, which I call their verision of musubis.

It was a very cute place for lunches. The service was very good and the food was so delicious!!
It was so fun to choose my bento/lunch box menu. There are so many options to choose. 
I wish they provide more selections of drinks. 
I'll definitely try the other bento with my daughter soon.

Kuben has been on my radar for a very long time, but I never found the time to go until today! Unfortunately, between finding the place and actually going, it looks like there's new management. And with new management comes a change in menu and product. This also means that most of the glowing reviews for Kuben are now null. Sadly, I didn't realize any of this until afterwards. So reader be warned, there is no beef bowl. The new salmon bowl is cooked. Check the dates of previous yelp reviews to make sure they're referring to the "new" Kuben.

I ordered the eel bowl. It was 10 dollars. There were 6 thin slices of eel, like wafer thin slices. Unlike the previous menu, you could not choose any toppings. The new menu says it's served over rice or mixed greens; I was never asked to choose and ended up getting a mix of both. There was a small smattering of sesame seeds and maybe a hint of furikake. The eel was tasty. The greens were too bitter for me. Without the personalized toppings, I felt like the bowl was pretty to look at but not very tasty. I wish they utilized the counter space a little more instead of disappearing into the kitchen to prep my food. 

Service was friendly but not very helpful in recommendations. I was the only patron when I entered, and it took 15 minutes for them to prep my bowl. I really wanted this place to be amazing, so I'll probably revisit Kuben in a few months hoping that they'll have improved. In the meantime...I'm really not wowed by this place at all.

I was so excited when I saw this place was coming in. Japanese Bento! Yes, there are plenty of sushi places that offer Bento options, but those are dine in and not typical for take out. This is ther perfect example of Japanese Bento Take Out. 

As a white girl who loves the Japanese culture and food, they were surprised when I walked in the door and spoke to them in Japnese- mind you I'm not fluent but they were susrpised non the less and had to do a dpuble take. Lol

A HUGR plus is they have Onigiri- Japanese Rice Balls- the kind we see characters in Anime eating all the time. So of course I had to try it (sorry not pictured) and it was AMAZING! Can I get that for breakfast!? I'm going to stop by tomorrow and try. :)

I ordered the Chickn Ben to and its tasty. Also comes in a very cute box as I have also added to Yelp photos. The sides a tasty, especially the tamago- Sweet Japanese Egg. I'm even liking the pickled veggies which I wasnr sure of at first. 

I am looking forward to seeing this place expand. I'm hoping they add many more dishes to their menu over time. I would like to see items not really found in other Japanese American restraunts. The more authentic the better! Ocha. Daifukumochii. Maybe a traditional japanese breakfast for a Bento box!? 

Looking forward to eating more of your food!

ja ne!

I have read some of the reviews. I'm surprised. I walked in and was like oh you only have sushi which I love but can't eat anymore for food allergies. The gentleman from South Korea was very polite and explained the menu. Some people say they weren't helpful. He was very helpful that's how we learned the gentleman was from South Korea. We got a bento bowl and the bento box. I saw that someone said the rice was too sticky and maybe they came at the wrong time of the day or just that batch was bad but ours was delicious. I was worried the chicken wasn't going to be too good and expected dark meat but nope it was really good and very flavorful. We really enjoyed our food and definitely plan to go back. I would suggest those with not so great reviews maybe give them a second chance. Ask to see if they can taste the rice before they get a second order or ask if they have rice less sticky. Ask why they cook the salmon and if they can get it uncooked maybe it's a regulation with the city. Either way we enjoyed it. I'm known usually for only writing reviews on places I enjoy. Those places that are okay won't get me to write. Those places that are just plan awful I really won't waste my time unless it's worth warning someone. So this was with my time to say check it out!

Don't let the size of the place fool you. The food was packed with flavor. When I walked in...I was like is this it??? No more?? Really??? Lol it's a tiny tiny place. It has a bar against the wall for people that are dining in. But I would recommend getting your food to go... There were maybe 8 seats total. But i actually ate here and it was really cool. So for ambiance I give them a 5/5... The place was tiny but very very clean and very cute!

The owner of the place was very nice. He actually gave my friend and I free miso soup which I thought was a great touch! And it was perfectly seasoned. I've had some miso soup where it was too salty or too bland but this one had just the right amount saltines with great miso flavor.  5/5 but just a heads up it did not have the seaweed or the tofu but hey it was free! :) and just a side note... While we were getting ready to go.. It started to pour outside and the chef and his assistant ran outside and played the rain! Puhahahaha it was hilarious! But when they came back in... They were like did you see the rain????  And they gave free drinks to the people that had just gotten their food... Reasoning... It was raining and that must make your thirstier so get a free drink! I didn't quite get the logic but it was very very sweet!

Don't forget to check in as you get a free soda! Yay!! Or you can get ice cold water from a cute little water cooler they have next to the coca cola fridge holding their canned drinks. They do not have a soda fountain...FYI. sucks but hey we can all get free refills on water. Lol 4/5 

I got the bento box with beef and onions... And I gotta tell ya.. It came with a tons of stuff!!! The pickled veg was sour with a hint of sweetness and it balanced out the food really nicely. Then you had some deep fried tofu skins and sweet egg pieces... Then a kurabota sausage with the steamed veggies and bacon wrapped quail eggs...I gotta tell y'all... Pretty much everything in that bento box was on point. The beef and onions tasted like a really good bulgogi... The meat looked a little sketchy at first since it looked like it had alot of fat... But nope the meat was tender and very flavorful. I just mixed all the meat and onions with the rice and dug in. It was delicious.  5/5

And last but not least... Service. It was great. They were very friendly and quickly took our order as soon as we told them that we were ready. :) 5/5

Heard about the bento boxes but opted for the chirashi. Ordered through Eat24 and they made my order after I arrived, which is a pet peeve of mine but it was ready fast and fresh. The portion size was okay; the fish was cut a little thinner than expected. The eel was really good though, so maybe that's the bowl to go for. The smoothies are also good, and I especially appreciate that they don't use any added sugar so they're actually healthy and make a great lunch when it's too hot to eat solid food.
A little big expensive but good tasted good.  One of places in vegas that has origini.  The spicy tuna rice ball was good.

I wanted to check this place out since it was getting good reviews. It took me a while to decide what I wanted to order from the menu but I went with the Chirashi bowl $11 and Tuna Mayo Rice Ball $2.50. There were 2 people ahead of me but it took them a while to get my order in and it was a bit of a wait for my food to be finished.
Restaurant is very clean and neat with cute decors. They offer japanese style bento boxes, small sushi rolls, and a few bowls.
I had never ordered a chirashi bowl anywhere before and its basically sashimi over rice. It came with 4 types of fish over warm rice. It was very plain and bland. I guess Im a poke bowl kind of girl where I expected more flavor and ingredients/sauce. The Tuna Mayo Rice ball was plain  as well. Both though very healthy. If I come back I probably would want to try one of their bento boxes.

Best place for musubi in vegas.... because it is the only place. 
I like the concept, minimalist and fresh. But it's basic blan tasting and over priced.

Rice and fish are fresh but the ratio between them is not equal, too much rice and not enough fish. Not to mention it took the guy working there forever to make my one order when I was also the ONLY person there
ANAZING! I love their poke salad, so much flavor, a bit in the spicy side but I'm a fan of spicy, if you want to kick it up a notch I suggest the lava sauce.

They are just back!! 
So friendly staffs and delicious food-!!
Perfect spot for grab and go

My BF and I stumbled across this place because the Thai place he wanted to take me to was no longer there so we drove around and VOIL√Å. All we saw was the word BENTO and we were sold.lol.

I'm going to assume that this place is fairly new because I don't recall it being there. Hmm... The place is cute, small and simple. The menu is not huge but my eyes lit up because they had bowls, bento boxes, mini rolls, rice balls, soups and salads. All the things I love.

The BF and I opted for the chicken bowl. From there you can pick your toppings. We also got one mini roll and a rice ball. 

Overall I like the concept. I think that the chicken could have been seasoned just a bit, but I enjoyed the bowl. We loved the mini roll and the rice balls. 

I definitely want to come back and try the bento and other rolls.

Kuben has possibly one of the best unagi bento boxes in spring valley. I've only got a chance to try them twice so far but they seem to be pretty consistent, and the owner always provides excellent service.

Their bento boxes comes with a variety of items that keeps your palate from getting bored and is organized in a very Snap/Instagram worthy way that is aesthetically pleasing to look at. Almost so that you don't want to eat it... almost.

Their unagi eel bento is very fresh and comes with about 10 pieces over a bed of rice. Each eel piece is surprisingly flavorful and soft, which it makes it very easy to chew and digest. Their salad is also good and comes with dressing separately which is an excellent decision and gives you the choice to decide how much dressing you want or save for later in case you don't want to start eating a soggy salad.

They also did a similar thing with their rice balls, so if you want to buy one and save it for lunch or a mid day snack, you don't have to worry about the seaweed getting soggy and nasty.

They are also updating their opening times starting on September 1st for those of us who aren't early birds. For it's conveniently located spot near where I live, I'm definitely sure that I'm going to come back and try more of their items soon.

Me and my husband both wanted the salmon bowl, but they told us they were only able to take one order because they were out of salmon for the day. It was 2 pm and they were going to be closing soon, so this was understandable. I wish my husband ordered a bento because I wanted to pick at his food, but instead, I think he was bummed he couldn't get a salmon bowl and went for 2 rice balls instead haha.

He enjoyed his beef rice ball more than the tuna one. I liked how fresh my salmon was over the rice. It was nice of them to make a mini bowl for my husband of their last pieces of salmon over some rice for free. Thank you!! We will be back to try their bentos next.

My colleagues and I researched a new place to try for lunch today and we chose Kuben. A small bento box restaurant where everything is home made.

Because we did our research before arriving, we all knew what to order. Two of us ordered the salmon bento box and one the chicken bento. We found a great check-in offer for a free drink. The drink case had many varieties of San Pellegrino canned drinks as well as soda, water and apple juice. We sat along the wall and listened to the KPOP playing in the restaurant (no BTS, but still nice music).

Our food came up within about 5 minutes and I went to the counter to pick it up and I told the Korean girl "Kamsahamnida" thank you in Korean. A gentlemen behind the counter came out and asked what I said and told her to give us all a free miso soup :-). Who knew being polite and knowing a few words in another language would get us all something! That was very nice of Kuben. 

We looked over the food and snapped a few pics (try not to drool as these pics are quite mouth watering). There was a very large assortment in the bento box. The cooked salmon steaks were served atop rice and topped with sesame seeds, a sausage with peppers, cauliflower and brussel sprouts, bacon wrapped mozzarella, some pickled veggies and egg with cooked tofu. Lastly there was a salad with a nice dressing. A filling meal that tasted delicious from the first bite to the last.

Lastly, whilst we were eating a young kid came in the store selling chocolate bars to raise money for basketball and the employees purchased the whole box. He then proceeded to give a bar to all of the customers! Very nice people at Kuben a truly over the top experience! If I could rate this place 6 stars I would.

I came here for lunch and there were no one inside but the two staff. We proceeded to order which was a total of 6 orders of their bentos, bowls and rice balls with drinks, this took about a hour to get all of our orders. Which we didn't understand since they cooked nothing? I spent over $100, but we pretty much tried everything. 

The food is not bad it's just that we would not wait for that long again for average food. I thought it was a great concept and addition to the neighborhood spots to go to. But they're just really really slow and I wouldn't come back with more than two people. 

Don't let my review discourage you from eating here, the food isn't bad it's just that I had maybe too many people for the two staff to manage at that time. It's definitely worth coming to even just to try.

Once you try an authentic bento box, the craving becomes insatiable. However, this is the place that outlasts any others. This is it! Although the restaurant inside is relatively small, the food makes up for it with its big and authentic taste.

I am truly obsessed with this restaurant, and have been bringing my friends here practically weekly to try their different bowls and bento boxes. My current obsession would definitely have to be their salmon bowl, but their bento boxes are hands down worth coming for.

Awesome bento box place!  All the ingredients were fresh and the price for the amount they give you really good.  Even the bento box looked fancy. The friendly staff and awesome music made it an enjoying place to eat your bento.  Definately will go there again.

I came here once before, after returning today there is new management a new menu. The new menu is far more extensive and has quite a few options. Very nice gentleman behind the counter did a wonderful job getting my order exactly correct and putting everything in my bowl that I wanted. I will definitely drive across town again to come here.

Such great service and tasty food! The Eel Bento, Chicken Breast Bento, Beef and Onion Bento, rice Chicken Rice Ball(onigiri), and the California Mini Roll we're our first choices and we we're completely satisfied!!

Honest food for an honest price. 

The young couple who runs this restaurant does it very efficiently. 

The food was decent and exactly what I expected. 

Couple of comments:

I don't eat meat besides fish. They should add vegetarian options to the bento box. 

Everything I was given for my meal was recyclable, yet nothing is recycled. Think about it.

The food was very tasty and clean here!!! 
And the service was phenomenal, and healthy healthy feeling after dining !!!!!
The food is good here. I order the beef and onion bento and it was delicious. The place in almost hidden in the small shopping center. The people working there are really nice too.
I love everything about Kuben, from their fresh menu to everything that i love. I can't say more about it but order online bc they get busy. Try everything.

A must try place!!! We ordered the bento teriyaki chicken, comes with edamame, 2pc gyoza,California roll,  rice,salad and miso soup..  everything is soooo delicious! And very reasonable price. The avocado sauce on the salad is the bomb! My husband ordered vegas borrito we love it too.. service is fast and very nice staff..

Just tried this place out for the first time and I do not regret it at all! The owner was extremely kind and funny. Prices are reasonable and the food is really great. I ordered a Beef and Onion Bento box and it comes with a variety of sides that is also very good. Then I ordered a strawberry smoothie, and as everything else, was very good. A great spot to try out! Will come back :)

First expression stay in or leave, it was over 80 degrees, husband order the eel and found 3 pin bones. I had the yellowtail and it was stale tasted old and cooked maybe because it was outside, it was warm!!

Great teriyaki chicken rice bowl . Tender..great flavor, prepared w special touches.  The terayaki sauce had too much pepper for us but they were kind enough to change out and the chef gave us a special salad w a honey apple dressing to cool things down.  We didn't even ask..they just did it.  Very nice people.  Good food.  The atmosphere is very casual.  Moderate pricing. Would've given 5 stars if the sauce was perfect, but I'd definitely return and recommend.

Not we expected for a bento box. Its not fresh cook. They cook in the morning & server as needed. Salmon is gross & dry. Everything in the bento box is not appetizing. The beef w/ onion is thinly sliced cut. The taste is so so. Will not be coming back. Wasted our money.
Go to bonsai have bento box & its much better. They cook to order.

I had high hopes for this place because it's so cute and clean, unique style and menu for this area, but the food was only so-so. The customer service is top notch, that is for certain. The food in the bento was edible but I couldn't say much beyond that. We had salmon bento and eel bentos. 
The rice was far too sticky and saturated and made for a really unappealing texture. Japanese rice isn't typically served this way. 
The eel had a decent flavor but again the texture was a bit off. The salmon also looked like it was potentially made ahead or previously frozen; I don't know if this is true, but this is the impression I got from look and texture of the ingredients. 
The Gyoza was not cooked fully, the outer edges were dry and completely raw, but of all three bento boxes, the gyoza was served this way, so I think this is just their method. Gyoza should be cooked fully and crispy on the widest end. 
The CA roll included tasted like what you'd get at the grocery store. 
I hate to have such a bad review for this place because it's clear this is a small business and they're trying very hard but the food is what needs to speak for a restaurant first and foremost and the food is just not that great. Additionally the wait time to get food was quite long. Prices, on the other hand, are low.
I'm not even done eating my to-go order yet and feel the need to write a review. SO GOOD! Just found "my new spot" fresh fish and super adorable.

My partner and I were planning on going to curry leaf. We passed by this on the way and we decided to go in. Its a cute little place that serves bentos, bowls (Chirashi, eel, salmon)

I ordered the beef and onion bento. The bento comes with a bunch of little cute sides to eat! Pickled veggies, quail egg and bacon, sausage veggies n some other little eats. For the price of the bento its worth every penny. I felt like I was in Japan! 

My partner enjoyed the Chirashi bowl. She's very picky with raw fish and she said the quality of the fish is very good! 

It's really a must try spot!

I come here for lunch/dinner maybe once or twice and week and it never disappoints. Everyone here is always so friendly and they actually remember me every time. The food is always spot on. I usually get the Eel bowl and it's always perfect. Just the right amount of flavor unlike some places where it justa tasted weird or they completely mask the flavor of the eel with a bunch of other things. Forever one of my favorite places for a quick bite to eat!

Nice place, the place is busy during the lunch time. We had the beef & onion bento and pork rib bento, both tasted pretty good. Really liked their side dishes, which included, sausage, bacon, sweet eggs, radish, veggies and salad. We also ordered the mango and strawberry smoothies, very fresh and not too sweet, which I like.

Definitely a bang for your buck type place. I really like the concept of Kuben, I just didn't love the food. 

I opted to get the salmon bento box. I should have asked what kind of salmon because I guess in my head I didn't expect it to be cooked salmon. It was cooked okay, but I'll probably give something else a try next time. You get a lot of different sides, which is what I really liked. My boyfriend got the unagi bento, which seemed so much more worth it! Definitely would have enjoyed my meal more if I got that.

The staff was super friendly! They only have one table with a bunch of bar seats along the wall. It was pretty quiet, we were the only ones dining in. There's only 1 girl that does everything so definitely don't come starved or the hangry might kick in!
This is probably my new favorite bento box spot! Everything is yummy and fresh tasting! Also, the service is amazing! I highly recommend trying any of their bento box and spicy tuna rice ball!!! :)

I came by to grab some lunch to bring to work. They were not open yet but owner was sitting out front and said he'd be happy to open early for me! Kyle was awesome and the food is yummy! Definitely coming back!!!

Wake up at 6am I was super hungry, i search by yelp this restaurant 
I got beef & onion bento Box($11) and salmon Onigiri ($2.50) bento was good but when I open salmon Onigiri , the fish was already expired 
I think I have to eat in 1 hour... 
the restaurant was cute inside and clean but no table to sit down. They have only bar maybe 7 or 8 people can sit down ...
My favorite was the salad dressing. Also everything was fresh and clean. Would come back for a quick meal.

Ok. I've been here few times. It took over one of my favorite bakery's that used to be there but I'm glad that this place is here. I've actually used the Yelp app to order too since I knew what I liked. The O Nigris are delish. All the flavors are good. However, if you don't like spicy I would suggest you stay away since spicy can be pretty spicy. I do have to admit that I like the beef over the chicken as the chicken was pretty dry the first time I've tried it but overall it's been good. I've definitely been back to just get the o nigri because that's my favorite. They also make it when you order so be prepared to wait a 5-10 minutes depending on how busy they are. Customer service is good and I definitely recommend stopping by to check it out at least.

water..... where's the... water.... 
The age (pronounced with a short e) may have been the saltiest thing I've ever eaten (also their sausage). Both are part of the bento box. The Age is supposed to be a little wet, but this was dripping. Age is one of my favorite things to eat and the one at Kuben was disappointing. 
The beef and onion bento was good, for the most part. The beef and onion (gyudon) had the thin cut meat and was the perfect amount of mirin/soy/sugar flavor. 
The salad is small, but a nice addition. The rest of the sides were decent, but nothing special. Edible, but nothing I want to go back to eat. 
I don't want to claim Kuben as a Japanese bento shop. It's an attempt, but not a very good one. The 4 stars only because it has zero competition.

Every single bite was A M A Z I N G!! I think I found my new fav spot. I got the salmon bento box and oh boy, let me tell you -- it was delicious!! Definitely coming back again and highly recommend Kuben! Owner (or employee) was very friendly and outgoing too! I'd give this place 10000/10

They also play great music ;)

We walked in and no one was around about five minutes later the employee came out from the back/kitchen to take our order - sounded like she was cleaning up so we waited patiently. As she was walking towards the register; at the same time we approach the counter, the phone rings and she picks it up. No worries, as I thought, she was going to place them on hold and help us.  NOPE! Didn't happen, and she took the entire phone order while my kids and I just stood there looking F$c%3n p-off. Bad customer etiquette, but then when she took our order super friendly that is total BS! Well, needless to say it took 15 minutes just to place our order from the time we walked into the front door.  Fuming!

I get it. it is a small shop just starting out, but they need to prioritize with the customers that is right in front of them, especially if we were there before the phone rings. Hopefully they'll get their act together and if she was the owner then I hope she reads this as this town is all about service and great food.  

Inside is small with 9 bar seats along the wall. Decor is ok nothing special.  I cannot recommend this for big family to dine in, but to go order - yes. 

We ordered 2 beef and onion bowl and added green onions. The bowls were very tasty and the meat reminded me of Yoshinoya but in a smaller portion. 3 stars

Ordered 3 bento boxes (Beef and Onion, Pork Ribs cutlets, and Eel) and they all came with a salad, bacon and quail eggs, sausage, and package seaweed.  My family said it tasted like most Japanese place we visit - nothing special 3 stars.

I will probably try this place again and hope the phone rings as I approach to see if the employee thinking towards customer service change before I make my final decision.  Currently, I'm only rating the food, if I were to generalize the entire review they would have gotten a 2 or fewer stars instead.
I tried the salmon bowl which was delicious!  It's so simple, but yummy. I ordered the chicken bowl for my son and he loved it. I loved how it was bento style. We will definitely be back!

This is a tough one.  The girl working was super nice and it's a cute space, albeit too warm.  They did not have a large drink selection, as they were out of most canned drinks.  The menu is relatively small and you can't get any nigiri or sashimi, it's not a traditional sushi place.  I did not get a bowl but they had lots of different ingredients that looked good.  I did get a few of their rolls, which tasted good, plus a few of their hand rolls (triangles).  The tamago triangle was good, but the salmon and tuna hand rolls are like canned salmon and tuna and are absolutely terrible.  My stomach also hurts a little.  I can't say it's from the food, but it's all I've had to eat today.

This Bento place is amazing ! Even though i live in Henderson, i come all the way over here to have this bento. It just makes me crave this beautiful Eel and Salmon Bento !!!! Even their salad is great, not too sweet but has it's own flavor . There are many little sides that come along and those are very unique sides . Also they got the poke fresh bowl and their fish tastes fresher than local ACYE sushi restaurants in the town. If you havent try this place then you are missing out !!!

I came here with my aunt on Friday during lunch and it wasn't busy at all. 

The decor was really nice and it was super clean. The people working there were really nice and the menu is super easy to pick and read. The atmosphere is pretty chilled and they play Korean music (some K-pop) overhead. 

Food: I got the eel bento while my aunt had the beef and onion bento. Overall the bento was pretty good. They packed my bento with a good amount of eel which was surprising to see. The sides weren't bad either which was salad with a sweet and tangy vinaigrette, sausage, bacon wrapped quail eggs (taste was good but the eggs were overdone), sweetened pieces of an omelette, and steamed cauliflower. 

The beef and onion was good as well but the cut of beef was ehh. My aunt have quite a bit of pieces of fat instead of meat which was a bit of a let down. Hence the 4 stars.

I also got their rolls which were pretty good but if you're not a fan of your sushi rolled in soy paper instead of seaweed then don't get it.  

Overall it was good. I'd come back next time to try their bowls.

This is soooo yummy :)
I ate chicken breast bento.
My kids likes this too.
Maybe I will be there again.

These bento plates are well worth it. I got the eel which was cooked perfectly. They definitely dont skimp out on their meat. Their customer service was awesome and their food was great. Will be back!!! Thank you guys.

I can't wait to come back here again. The food is really good and you get a lot of it for the price. 

I had the Chirashi bowl which had 4 different kinds of fish, ginger, and rice. One of the types of fish that it comes with is the eel, which was so tender and well seasoned  that I'm looking forward to getting an eel bowl specifically in the future. I also took a pork bowl home and had it the next day for lunch and the pork was also cooked perfectly. I'd order both of these again. Just a quick note that the fish bowls do not come with added toppings. The menu lists "bowl toppings" but doesn't specify that it's just for the rice & noodle bowls. 

The reason why I can't give this place 5 stars is because of the seating. There's only about 8-10 seats in the restaurant, so if you're planning to eat in, that might not happen. They definitely have enough room to comfortably add a couple of 2 person tables inside, but currently just have wasted space. 

I really enjoyed the food here, and I can't wait to go back, but I can't comfortably stop here before heading somewhere else because of the fact that eating in is hit or miss. 

Update: I'm upping my review to 5 stars as they've added more seating to the restaurant. Theres is now a four person table in the back and a two person table in the front. It adds six more seats and makes it easier to find a spot to sit and eat in. They've also recently changed their hours and now open later but also stay open later as well. And the food is still absolutely delicious. I can't wait to stop in again!
this is definitely my place to get lunch for bento! it is by far the best bento ive had in vegas hands down. I will be back for sure

Best sushi I've had anywhere in Vegas! The freshest ingredients, portions are great and the sushi rolls aren't all rice. We tried a California and Philadelphia roll and they were awesome as well as some of the best kimchi I've had since 1999. Apparently they are under new management and it feels like the couple that runs it looks over every ingredient and recipe with the intent of giving the most to the customer instead of focusing on only the bottom line.

I took my family here for lunch. We ordered 2 chirashi bowls $11 each, 1 chicken bowl $7, And 2 salmon bento box $12 each. The food came out and caught me by surprised as the food was poorly presented and tasted awful. My chirashi bowl literally had 3 THIN SLICES of salmon, tuna, and yellowtail. The fish was not fresh at all!! The rice was so hard that all I ate just was the fish n threw the rice away. My kids said they heard some microwaving so I'm assuming they were microwaving my rice? Anyways, I think it was not worth the $11 each. Ive had other poke places for the samr price but much better. Also, the salmon bento box was ok for my kids. I'm not if I'm even ever going to come back here again.

Tried the eel bento, which was delicious. A large serving of well-prepared eel over a bed of white rice, accompanied by a variety of sides, was the perfect lunch. The place itself is small and quaint with a clean, simple style. There isn't very much seating for a true sit-down experience, but it seems the restaurant is more designed for pick-up and to-go orders. In addition to good food, the staff were friendly and welcoming, too.

Stumbled upon this cute little place that also happen to be their opening day. Cashier was very nice and friendly. She took her time to explain the menu. Chefs were nice and also greeted us. 

Their seating area is just a bar along the wall with stools. More of a to-go kinda spot than a dine-in.

I ordered the Chirashi bowl. Quality of the fish was better than I expected. Very clean cuts. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends and family.

The people working here are so nice and they have a really good affordable bento box. My oldest LOVES the salmon teriyaki and my other boys think the chicken teriyaki bowl is the best. The place is small, but very clean (which is big for me as a germaphobe). I'm so glad this place is just down the road from us!

Get the eel! It's yummy. Beef in bento is a big sweet but still delicious. I really appreciate the presentation of the food. The spam rice ball is so flavorful! 

Con: We waited about 45 minutes for our food.  

Do not come here is you are in a rush or only have an hour lunch break. But if you got some time, give it a try. The food is delicious!

I agree with all the other reviews on here!  I didn't think the side options were going to be very good but I was definitely wrong.  The flavors were great, very nice portions and good service. While I was there on Saturday, they had a steady flow of 1 or 2 people coming in every few minutes while I was waiting for my food (so I'm glad to see this place is doing business)

I have one pro/con here.  The presentation/packing was really nice, however because of that, we pay for that nice packaging which adds to the cost of the meal.  I would rather see the packaging be a little more basic and bring the cost down.  

All in all, I will absolutely be back and I will definitely recommend this place to others.

I had never been here before. Was in the area and checked for restaurants with good reviews. Kuben DID NOT DISAPPOINT! Had a salmon bento box and it was outstanding. Salmon was seasoned perfectly. Food was so good I stayed a little longer and ordered a mini California roll too! Excellent food.

The taste and concept is good. Quick made to order Onigiri and bowls that can be customized and eaten on the go. 

Friendly staff and you get a free soda w/Yelp check in.

Pricing could be better, since they are made fresh -wait times are longer. 

I had the spicy tuna mayo but my friend customized an Onigiri w/beef and spicy sauce which was sweet and delectable.

I remember seeing this place before they opened for business and I thought this was going to be a Cuban restaurant with a twist or something. But surprise, surprise! They serve Japanese bento boxes, sushi rolls, Sashimi, doughnut sushi, sushi burrito, salads, and such.

Salmon Skin Salad: 5/5

Salmon Carpaccio: 5/5

Salmon Sashimi Bowl: 5/5

Donut Sushi: 5/5
I wasn't sure how I would attack a doughnut sushi. Do I eat it with chopsticks? Should I pick it up with my bare hands? So, I started with chopsticks and when I had a small portion left, I wrapped it in seaweed and picked it up with my hands. You can choose what you want on your doughnut sushi (fish, sauce). I got tuna and salmon with ponzu.

Cowboy Roll: 5/5
When you want beef and fish at the same time, like surf and Turf, this is the roll for you. Or if you have friends who doesn't like the concept of raw fish, this is it for them. Crab, cucumber, beef with ponzu and eel sauce. I got it without gobo.

I've been here a couple of times now and everything has been consistent: great service and good quality food(especially fresh fish). They even remembered me from the pictures I posted on here.

I appreciate that you can get good food for a reasonable price. Their space is small so I'd imagine they get packed during busy lunch hours. I've only been here at night after going to the gym and right before they close. You can always get your food to-go. I'm excited that they cater - I'm definitely having one of my meetings catered by Kuben!
Great food! Especially the raiders burrito and amazing salad the sauces were on point and great customer service would recommend to other people.

Attentive and friendly staff, keep going here since their onigiri (rice balls) are awesome. They're open really early, honestly the earliest time and that benefits me who works early or goes to school at 8am. Prices are reasonable. No space to eat so it's a TO-go place
This is probably the place to get your bentobox and onigiri it was so delicious! Very nice and friendly staff. Definitely a must-try place.

This food reminds me of bentos and meals I had in Japan. Simple food with the right flavors. I've been a couple times and have tried a few things: eel bento, pork bento, pork bowl, beef and onion bowl. My favorites are the eel bento and the beef and onion bowl.  The bento has a lot of little treats, sausage, picked veg, seaweed, bacon wrapped egg (quail?), salad. I usually can't it is all at once. The meals are well priced, but the additions for the bowls are kinda pricy for what you get. The other annoying thing is that they never seem to have the egg. Why can't you make an egg?

We saw this place when we were running errands and decided to give it a try. The employees are very kind and helpful. They were welcoming and were happy to tell us about our options.

Our food was fantastic! I had the Mayo garlic chicken bent box and my boyfriend had the Philadelphia roll bento box. We also got a baked lasagna roll. The food was so fresh and tasty! Can't wait to come back and try something else!

This little restaurant is close to home. We randomly decided to drop in. And were so glad we did! The beef and onion bowl reminds me of the beef bowl at Yoshinoya.. but better!! The rice here is dusted with a generous amount of furikaki. Soooo good. My complaint is that it's pretty pricey for what it is. But I haven't found anything like it since Yoshinoya left Las Vegas. So.... Compromise...

We ordered a yellow tail "donut". I couldn't eat it bc I'm preggers. But my husband says he enjoyed it. He did comment, however, that it was hard to eat the seaweed with it, since the donut sat on the seaweed and the seaweed wasn't cut with the donut. 

We also ordered a salmon burrito. This was a pleasure to surprise since it wasn't a giant burrito but rather 2 smaller burritos. Makes it much easier to eat!! It was also really tasty. Next time, I'm going to ask if they can make it with seaweed wrapping instead of soy paper. 

Salmon skin roll was just okay. I think I was disappointed that the rice wasn't vinegared. So it really lacked flavor. Probably won't be ordering this one again. 

Overall, delicious!

Finished and paid for our order at 12:21 pm.
Told Yenny ( accdg to the receipt) that we will be back in 10 mins to pick it up. At that time, therewas no other customer but us. Came back.  Went in line to pick up. To our shock none of Our food is ready. I wasked why is our order not ready. She said she got busy with other orders. Hmmmm. Long story short.  Our food that should have been ready by 12:31 was ready by 1:10 pm.
Not a happy camper.
Food was good though.

Full disclosure: I have not visited this restaurant; this review is for the food I had delivered. I'm pretty sure this establishment uses a third party delivery service; keep that in mind when you read any comments about the delivery itself, please!

I really don't know if I should even be writing this. It's my first order from Kuben, so I haven't really sampled much of their menu. But it's a good review! So no harm done, right?

Wow! I ordered the unagi bento, miso soup, and a salmon rice ball. I initially subtracted two stars; the miso soup was bland, with no wakame or tofu. The salmon balls were inexplicably spicy! Of course the Korean printing on the label should have given me a clue. 

The bento box, however was beautifully prepared and presented. I would have preferred some steamed sesame spinach instead of the included packaged salad, and the sausage was a bit off-putting in both appearance and taste, but there was fully SIX SUSHI ORDERS' WORTH OF UNAGI! If you ordered 6 orders of unagi sushi from a sushi menu at a price of $6.50 per order (2 pieces per order) ... well, you do the math! This bento was a bit more than twelve bucks, plus taxes, delivery and tip. Great bargain! The eel wasn't prime grade, but it wasn't cat food either. And really, the salmon rice balls, although unexpectedly spicy and probably not made in-house, were actually ample in size and very tasty!

So, minus just one star for the really dismal miso soup. 

A word about the delivery service, which I suspect, as I said, is a third party. It was about an hour later than guaranteed. Yelp helped out with that though, and very promptly, too. It's just a bit hard getting to the customer service section on the YelpEat24 app.

Good place for lunch! I'm looking forward to trying the other items on the menu.
Presentation is truly where this place shines. Still the same quality of all these other fast sushi places. Not bad but not fantastic. Pleasant service clean atmosphere

I Ordered delivery on UberEATS for the first time. The bentos came surprisingly well packed with lots of delicious side dishes(?). I ordered the eel bento and loved it. Portion was great (plenty of eel) and their pickled radish, boiled quail eggs with bacon around it, and sausage was really good too. My husband ordered the beef and onion bento. He enjoyed all the side dishes, too. BUT unlike the eel bento, you get very little meat with the rice. My husband wasnt even done with half the rice by the time he finished the meat. Their mini rolls are also good and i enjoyed the dressing that came with the salad. Packaging is really well done. Overall, i enjoyed it. I would order again.

I came here for bento box.But somehow I ordered bowl...haha
Well just decently bowl.nothing special.
Just rice was so warm wit sashimi.thats not much well...

Inside is clean n bright which I like it.
There is bar counter for eat in.
Seems like just fast eat place like eat n leave so quick.

I will try bent box next time!
Awesome place! Great atmosphere and the staff is super friendly. Great concept, I can see this place going very far
So I came back the next day had a craving for the rice balls the spicy tuna mayo, spam, salmon again and chicken.  Yenny helped me she is awesome.
